text: The Thrill Hunter is a 1926 American silent comedy adventure film directed by Eugene De Rue and starring William Haines, Kathryn McGuire and Alma Bennett.Langman p.261 An American is mistaken for the ruler of a small European principality, and forced to marry. He manages to escape, and publishes an account of his adventures. ==Cast== * William Haines as Peter J. Smith * Kathryn McGuire as Alice Maynard * Alma Bennett as Princess Zola * E. J. Ratcliffe as T.B. Maynard * Bobby Dunn as Ferdie * Frankie Darro as Boy Prince ==Preservation status== *An incomplete print is held at the Library of Congress archive.The Library of Congress/FIAF American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog:The Thrill HunterCatalog of Holdings The American Film Institute Collection and The United Artists Collection at The Library of Congress, (<-book title) p.184 c.1978 by The American Film Institute ==References== ==Bibliography== * Langman, Larry. American Film Cycles: The Silent Era. Greenwood Publishing, 1998. ==External links== * * Category:1926 films Category:American films Category:American silent feature films Category:English-language films Category:Columbia Pictures films Category:American black-and-white films Category:American adventure comedy films Category:1920s adventure comedy films Category:1926 comedy films
title: The Thrill Hunter (1926 film)
